title: IOS 18
content: {{AFC submission|d|n|u=67.185.99.213|ns=118|decliner=KylieTastic|declinets=20240505214351|reject=yes|ts=20240505211813}} {{AFC submission|d|n|u=146.19.59.50|ns=118|decliner=CNMall41|declinets=20240212090610|reject=yes|small=yes|ts=20240212074941}} {{AFC submission|d|nn|u=118.221.245.65|ns=118|decliner=ItsCheck|declinets=20240204235906|small=yes|ts=20240204193244}} {{AFC submission|d|nn|u=Vajkimzeej|ns=118|decliner=KylieTastic|declinets=20240123095206|small=yes|ts=20240122193244}} {{AFC submission|d|nn|u=Vajkimzeej|ns=118|decliner=KylieTastic|declinets=20240122085631|small=yes|ts=20240122015002}} {{AFC submission|d|v|u=2600:6C50:75F0:19D0:54E6:4025:456D:423B|ns=118|decliner=Qcne|declinets=20231223210855|small=yes|ts=20231223210405}} {{AFC comment|1=Submitting without improvement again [[User:KylieTastic|KylieTastic]] ([[User talk:KylieTastic|talk]]) 21:43, 5 May 2024 (UTC)}} {{AFC comment|1=Already stated [[WP:TOOSOON]] by numerous editors. Also submitting without improvement. [[User:CNMall41|CNMall41]] ([[User talk:CNMall41|talk]]) 09:06, 12 February 2024 (UTC)}} {{AFC comment|1=[[Wp:TOOSOON]] [[User:ItsCheck|ItsCheck]] ([[User talk:ItsCheck|talk]]) 09:52, 23 January 2024 (UTC)}} {{AFC comment|1=pointless resubmission with no improvement - [[Wp:TOOSOON]] [[User:KylieTastic|KylieTastic]] ([[User talk:KylieTastic|talk]]) 09:52, 23 January 2024 (UTC)}} {{AFC comment|1=Wikipedia does not publish articles on rumors and speculation [[User:KylieTastic|KylieTastic]] ([[User talk:KylieTastic|talk]]) 08:56, 22 January 2024 (UTC)}} {{AFC comment|1=[[WP:TOOSOON]] '''[[User:Qcne|Qcne]]''' [[User talk:Qcne|(talk)]] 21:08, 23 December 2023 (UTC)}} ---- {{Short description|Upcoming 2024 mobile operating system}} {{Draft topics|software|computing|technology}} {{AfC topic|media}} {{lowercase title}} {{Draft article|subject=media}} {{Unannounced product draft}} {{Infobox OS | name = iOS 18 | logo = | logo size = | logo caption = | logo alt = | screenshot = | caption = | screenshot_alt = | collapsible = | version of = [[iOS]] | developer = [[Apple Inc.]] | family = [[iOS]] | working state = | source model = [[Proprietary software|Closed]] with [[open-source software|open-source]] components | released = | discontinued = | RTM date = | GA date = | latest release version = | latest release date = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | repo = | marketing target = [[iPhone]]s | programmed in = | language = | language count = | language footnote = | update model = [[Software Update]] | package manager = | supported platforms = | kernel type = | userland = | ui = | license = | preceded by = [[iOS 17]] | succeeded by = | website = | support status = | other articles = }} '''iOS 18''' is the [[IOS version history|eighteenth and upcoming major release]] of [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s [[iOS]] operating system for the [[iPhone]]. It will be revealed at the 2024 [[Worldwide Developers Conference]], following the tradition of iOS reveals. It is the direct successor to [[iOS 17]]. It will be announced at Apple's annual [[Worldwide Developers Conference]] alongside watchOS 11, [[Draft:IPadOS 18|iPadOS 18]], and the new major version of [[macOS]]. As with every release since [[iOS 4]], updates are available at no additional cost to users. Being the successor to iOS 17, iOS 18 will see a developer beta right after WWDC. Public betas then will occur in July, and will be publicly released in the fall of 2024. Devices with an [[Apple A15 Bionic|A15 Bionic]] [[system on chip]] and later will be fully supported, while the devices with [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] and [[Apple A14 Bionic|A14 Bionic]] chips will have limited support. == System features == === AI === [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] will catch up companies with AI, spending US$1 billion a year on research and large language models. AI will mainly be used on device, with more complicated requests being sent to be processed on servers. === Messages === Apple has pledged to adopt [[Rich Communication Services]] (RCS) in 2024 with iOS 18. It will be used in place of [[SMS]] or [[Multimedia Messaging Service|MMS]] when available on both devices to have better quality conversations with non-Apple devices ineligible for [[iMessage]]. === Siri === [[Siri]] will be incorporating [[Large language model|large language models]] (LLMs) to make shortcut integrations more accessible.{{Cite web |last=Adorno |first=José |date=2024-01-04 |title=iOS 18: Release date, AI, supported iPhones, and everything we know |url=https://bgr.com/guides/ios-18/ |access-date=2024-01-15 |website=Boy Genius Report}}{{Cite web |date=2024-01-12 |title=iOS 18: Everything We Know |url=https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/ios-18/ |access-date=2024-01-15 |website=MacRumors}} Rumors suggest that Siri will have better conversation capabilities and improved personalization. ==Supported devices== iOS 18 may drop support for iPhones with an [[A12 Bionic]]{{Efn|[[iPhone XS]], XS Max, [[iPhone XR|XR]]}} [[SoC]]. The following devices will be able to run iOS 18: * [[iPhone XR]] * [[iPhone XS|iPhone XS & XS Max]] * [[iPhone 11]] * [[iPhone 11 Pro|iPhone 11 Pro & 11 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone SE (2nd generation)]] * [[iPhone 12|iPhone 12 & 12 Mini]] * [[iPhone 12 Pro|iPhone 12 Pro & 12 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone 13|iPhone 13 & 13 Mini]] * [[iPhone 13 Pro|iPhone 13 Pro & 13 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone SE (3rd generation)]] * [[iPhone 14|iPhone 14 & 14 Plus]] * [[iPhone 14 Pro|iPhone 14 Pro & 14 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone 15|iPhone 15 & 15 Plus]] * [[iPhone 15 Pro|iPhone 15 Pro & 15 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone 16|iPhone 16 & 16 Plus]] * [[iPhone 16 Pro|iPhone 16 Pro & 16 Pro Max]] * [[iPhone SE (4th generation)]] == See also == * iPadOS 18 * tvOS 18 * watchOS 11 * visionOS 2 ==References== {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{Succession box |title=iOS 18 |years=2024 |before=[[iOS 17]] |after=[[iOS 19]] }} {{S-end}} {{Apple software}} {{Draft categories| [[:Category:IOS|*18]] [[:Category:2024 software]] [[:Category:Products introduced in 2024]] [[:Category:Mobile operating systems]] }}
